instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01958: What is 820-01958? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboot crashing
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that reboots as soon as the OS starts to load. No liquid or drop damage.

Tried revive option in apple configurator 2 no change. Data is important.

Disconnected all attached devices except screen and another test with just external but no change.

Also when trying internet recovery as soon as progress bar finishes loading it will crash right after as well just like when OS starts to load.

What should be checked next???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboot crashing
threads.message:
Can you enter macOS in safe mode?
To recover data, try starting in Target Disk mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01958</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> reboot crashing
threads.message: solved after backing up data via target disk mode and using restore option in apple configurator 2
